title: Rise in alcohol, drug abuse among pregnant mothers in coastal areas
byline: There is an increase in alcohol and drug use among pregnant mothers living along Sri Lanka’s coastal areas including Dehiwala, Mount Lavinia, Ratmalana, Moratuwa and Egoda Uyana, thus raising serious concerns, Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia Municipal  Council Opposition Leader and Specialist Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: 'Praja Shakthi' rural poverty eradication drive begins today
byline: The Praja Shakthi National Programme, aimed at eradicating rural poverty and uplifting communities, will officially commence today under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Sri Lankan Bishop gets post in Vatican
byline: Bishop of Badulla Jude Nishantha Silva has been appointed by Pope Leo XIV as a member of the Inter Religious Dicastery in the Vatican.

title: Well known banker Rienzie Wijetilleke passes away
byline: Well known banker Rienzie Wijetilleke passed away this morning, according to family members.

title: Legendary elephant ’Kadol’s tusks displayed at Kataragama Perahera
byline: The tusks of ’Kadol’, the legendary elephant that supported King Dutugemunu in his battle against King Elara, have been brought out for public display in conjunction with the sixth day procession (Perahera) of the historic Ruhunu Kataragama Maha Devalaya. The tusks will remain on display until the Perahera concludes on the 2nd.

title: Bureaucracy not aligned with Govt. - Minister
byline: A key minister admitted that bureaucracy does not fall in line with the government in the realization of its targets in an expeditious manner.

title: SJB to file legal action against LG Commissioners who played  politics: Sajith
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) plans to take legal action against the Local Government Commissioners who worked according to the whims and fancies of the ruling National People’s Power (NPP), Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said yesterday.

title: Ami Upul shot dead in Ragama gun attack
byline: A man identified as Ami Upul, a known associate of underworld figure Ganemulla Sanjeewa, was shot dead in a gun attack in the Batuwatte area of Ragama last night (3), police said.

title: Sri Lanka’s provision of inaccurate data comes under IMF scrutiny
byline: The government’s provision of inaccurate data to the International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) has come under review by its Executive Board.
